Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that all child support in the United States will end by the beginning of 2018, which is not true.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no such law has been passed to end all child support in the United States.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible sources provided to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the information on the fake news website is true, which is a problematic assumption.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting typos and sentences that make no sense in the fake news article.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim suggests that states set child support policies and have enforcement programs, indicating that there are alternative explanations to the claim made in the fake news article.
